website_summaries.verdict: Very affordable chewy treats that help calm cats ahead of traveling or stressful situations.
pros: Contains L-Theanine and Thiamine to reduce stress without changing your cat's personality
Feature a chicken liver flavor that most cats love
cons: Chews are too big for some cats to have all at once

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new kitty and he's been really stressed out with this change. He was living in an abandoned house, fending for himself and we rescued him! These chews help calm him down quite a bit. The chews were pretty hard, so I cut one up and he ate it no problem. And the kitty tries to eat everything so getting him to eat it won't be a problem I don't think. So glad we got these!! Thank you! You saved us all! Lol
customer_reviews.author: jayme

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat is way less needy but I'm pretty sure it's because she's stoned off her ass.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Tambling

customer_reviews.title: I am a feline care and behavior specialist and recommend these to all of my clients
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous aid for any cat lover, I am a feline care and behavior specialist and recommend these to all of my clients. Currently I am using these to help tame a feral adult cat that - up until a few weeks ago - had never been touched. He is making fantastic progress and I believe this product takes part of the credit for it. If you could make them without canola oil that would be even better, hence one star less. Canola oil is not something I would recommend to ingest for the long term, but it this case the benefits are worth it to help save a life.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja K.

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars — too hard to chew!
customer_reviews.text: These treats are SO HARD that my bigger cat (10 lbs.) can barely chew them and my smaller cat (7 lbs.) won’t eat them at all. I can tell that they both like the flavor, but doesn’t matter if they’re that much trouble! I don’t want to waste time getting a refund for seven dollars, so I’m just gonna throw these away and recommend that no one else by them either.
customer_reviews.author: Beth H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My Vet recommended this product for my male cat. He was a feral and we worked with him for months to make him into a big, lovey house cat. But he does get skittish fairly easily and this product works really well, especially keeping him calm when there are thunderstorms. I have bought this product several times and will continue to use it. The picture above shows him after eating 3 of these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Harborcreek PA

customer_reviews.title: Helps calm household tensions from a new addition
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats, one of whom is a teenager and currently driving everybody in the house nuts. We started giving everyone these treats at bedtime, so we could actually sleep through the night, and to decrease some household tensions that seem to emerge among the older two after sundown. Behold, a cure for the midnight zoomies!
customer_reviews.author: Magenta Prex

customer_reviews.title: My cats not interested, chews were too hard
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 cats, 1 tried to eat a piece but the chews are very hard. I broke them into smaller pieces but they would not eat even then. I wondered if the package I got was stale because the chews are even hard to break in half. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: APC

customer_reviews.title: It worked for one of my cats - and he was the one that needed them most
customer_reviews.text: I used these with my cats before a six hour drive for the holidays. The cat that usually is anxious and vocal ended up being call, cool and collected. He napped almost the entire time; it was like night and day and he was so much happier upon arrival. On the flip side, it had no effect on my other cat. He was his normal, prowling self. He wandered throughout the car. While he wasn't nervous, he was just as restless as always during a car trip. If you are relying on this to calm your cat for a particular occasion, I would suggest you test it first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats Would Not Eat
customer_reviews.text: I would love to be able to speak to the actual effectiveness of this product, however, I cannot as both of my cats refused to eat these treats! They enjoy various brand of treats in various flavors, and this is the first treat they have come across that they will not even lick. I can't recommend these treats as my cats simply were repulsed by them.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow_Sloth

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try.
customer_reviews.text: We have five cats in our household. Four were from an existing colony, and one was added to the colony. It has helped to reduce the stress in our house tremendously. The added cat had never been around other cats and also had limited human contact. He was always on edge, and tried to fight everybody (including us) in the house. Now, he is much calmer and also has become more social. I have tried many calming treats, but this one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Horan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for special occasions
customer_reviews.text: OMG, is like a sedative for felines!!! I gave them one to each cat the first day to try how they worked and if they tolerated them and one of them badly could stand u, all of them took a nap. Maybe is a healthy alternative for moments stressful for them like dates with firecrackers on the streets, too much movement in the house in a special situation, or when you NEED to sleep because you have a job interview next day and you need your furry babies to allow you to rest. I just use them for special occasions, if you want to use it all the time, maybe need to not to have a cat. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Worthless if your pet wont eat them
customer_reviews.text: My cat literally runs away from these. It doesn’t matter how I try to disguise them. They are also hard as a rock. I have tried a couple years ago to use these for my nervous kitty but couldn’t remember why I stopped. I ordered them again recently and when I tried to give her the first one, she sniffed it and took off. Then I remembered. I wish there was something like this that she found palatable. Worthless if I can’t get her to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: It has work for my kitty😻💕
customer_reviews.text: I have read all the reviews. My kitty is a rescue and was extremely stressed at the rescue as she was given away after8 years in one home. I found these and bought them. She refused to eating alone. Now I crush half a one in her wet food mix it up and she eats it all. I have noticed a positive difference in her. She is more social and spends time cuddling. The first 3 months I had her she lived under the bed. So I give a positive thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Feral help
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in hopes that it would help my "recovering" feral cat. Have been using for almost one year now. It seems to have helped improve her anti-social behavior immensely. She now interacts and plays, with the other 2 (domestic) cats, and is approachable. Prior to initiating this product, she would truly hide all day under a sofa. All 3 of my cats (and dogs) LOVE the taste of these calming treats. All of the cats come running when they hear the crumple sound of this bag. I'm giving 4 stars since I cannot prove this is the reason for her behavior change, but I strongly do not think this is a coincidence. Now I'm on "auto refill".
customer_reviews.author: Ms K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product I’m very pleased with this purchase. Bella our daughter cat is very skittish and sometimes charges our new cat. This treats totally relaxed her and she didn’t charge ir hiss. I highly recommend this product. Thank you Amazon for giving us so many choices
customer_reviews.author: Queen Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not the result I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: This product which is supposed to calm my cat made her absolutely crazy! I wanted a calming product so that I can trim her nails this was a total failure on all levels. The smell and hardness was a big turnoff for her. I tried again by crushing the pieces and soaking them in chicken broth with added tiny pieces of chicken. She still balked but ingested just enough to make her lose her cat mind!
customer_reviews.author: .999GG

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: They're pretty good. My cat has twitchy cat syndrome and some days are worse than others so I give these to him to help relax. Unfortunately it puts him out hard. Which- it may just be that his body needed the rest after twitching and freaking out. He's a Siberian mix so fairly large and heavy (20ish pounds) so it only works for about two hours and he's back to running around. But it's cheap enough that if I need more than one a day I can easily buy more throughout the month.
customer_reviews.author: Darian

customer_reviews.title: seemed to be calming
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a feral cat that we keep on our large patio. She was extremely spooked and was climbing the screened enclosure. These seemed to calm her down a bit. We used them sparingly only we her stress level was high. We will reserve the rest of the bag for future use. I imagine will be helpful should we ever need to take her to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work! Sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use on my feral cat who had taken to hiding in holes in the wall, inside the washer and dryer motors, stress grooming, eating at only 3 in the morning and excessive scratching at her neck or wherever she could reach. After taking these at her middle of the night feedings noticed she was coming out at the regular feeding times and asking for attention again and fur starting to regrow. Will continue to use 1 treat twice a day. She would not eat as treat but they are easy to break up over regular wet/dry food. Sadly on my other flaky sketchy cat they seemed to have no effect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knocks my cat out in a good way
customer_reviews.text: I used these to help my cat after moving. He is a total stress case, biting me, crying, etc. I gave him three of these (more than the regular dosage) and he slept for four hours. He loved the taste--they smell like brewer's yeast (the first ingredient). I give him one when he starts to get stressed, and it takes the edge off. Whatever is in these works really well at just chilling him out, no negative effects. I honestly think what they mainly do is make him sleepy. It's a very small bag, but I will certainly always have some on hand in case there's a thunderstorm or a garbage truck or something else to freak him out.
customer_reviews.author: Psyche Ready

customer_reviews.title: Not Appealing To The Cats, VERY TOUGH for them to cgew
customer_reviews.text: Poor cats. These things are hard, and smell gross. My young (6) cat ate 2 the first day. My senior (13) cat licked at it and tried to chew it but couldn't. She just let it drop out of her mouth. Day 2, broke one into smaller pieces, for senior, but she sniffed and walked away. Younger cat batted hers around till it went under the fridge. Tried one more and she walked away. Can't calm them if they can't/don't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: KKelly2

customer_reviews.title: Addictive
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if these are actually calming my cat down or not but it makes me feel like I'm doing something by trying. But I will say, my cat is very picky and he LOVES these. I give him one every time I leave for work. And it's gotten to the point where he can't wait for me to leave so he can get his treat! Meow, meow, meow when he sees me packing up my work stuff. What a traitor.
customer_reviews.author: btrfliesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my spazzy Russian blue
customer_reviews.text: My cat Rocket is an absolute spazz. I’m talking, jumping up walls, meowing loudly, chasing things that aren’t there, twitching uncontrollably and then darting as fast as he can to the other end of the house... these treats really seem to calm him down! And he likes to eat them too, which is a plus. I do wish they were about half the size though. I have to break them in half for him because he can’t seem to get the whole thing in his mouth at once. Definitely recommend if you’ve got a crazy kitty!
customer_reviews.author: BWilson

customer_reviews.title: Peace among cats
customer_reviews.text: My nervous older lady cat with the easily upset tummy is so much happer and sociable, now that she gets her morning and evening composure biscuit. And my nervy, very assertive boy cat who loves to chase her, uninvited, is less aggressive when he gets half a biscuit each morning. Only the occasional hissing fits, now, and far less plucked fur. My big boy cat is already complacent and doesn't need any, but gets jealous of their treats, so he just gets an ordinary bit of the old lady's richer kibble for his treat. Finally, relative peace in the colony.
customer_reviews.author: Okumo Press

customer_reviews.title: dud
customer_reviews.text: I have many cats 10+ and none would eat these chews....very hard, not very chewy... the only way i was able to get cats to eat these was soaking them in either tuna or chicken juice
customer_reviews.author: rainallweek

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help transition a street car to an indoor car, in addition to moving from a home to an apartment to another apartment in the span of a few months (when we lost my bfs dad to cancer so there was a ton of added stress from us too) It helped so much! We keep it around for stressful situations
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Large treats, my cat wont eat them.
customer_reviews.text: The treats arrived still feeling soft in the hands- not stale. But they are at least 2x the size of a normal cat treat. I had to break one of them into 3 pieces so my cat could even try to eat them. Unfortunately she wont even try to eat one and there are few things she wont eat. Until I can convince her to eat one I cannot speak on the calming effects for my cat- I bought this to help her relax while she gets shaved for the spring (5" long fur is too long for my local climate) I'll update my review if she ever eats one
customer_reviews.author: Rylee

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for cat to eat.
customer_reviews.text: This might be a decent product for the intended purpose of calming your cat, however, it was so hard that our cat couldn't chew it. We even cut it into several small pieces, but it didn't help. It must be appealing to cats since she tried so hard again and again. Very disappointed, she really needs this to calm her while we groom her 3.5" long hair and for trips to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: really helpful
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much but my vet recommended this product. My cat would not eat the treats so I ground half of one treat up in a baggie and sprinkled into her wet food. She ate it and was mellow and slept much of our 6 hour trip. Super helpful. We used it with lots of Feliway spray in her carrier and were so pleasantly surprised that the combination worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Even the Oink would not eat them
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps these were so bad because they were completely dried out. I have one cat that will eat practically anything, and he gets very stressed when he goes to the vet. I hoped to use these on him, but he wouldn't touch them, so I can't say whether they would have worked or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews said my cat won't eat these. Mine won't either. Plain got spit into litter box. Covered in tuna oil, bacon or ham grease, chicken broth, little sheba, or as cat nachos got ignored--not even licked. This company seriously needs to address this off reported issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These treats were a waste of money... the first day my cat tried them and he was feeling super anxious and stressed due to new puppy... I have him double the dose as stated on package and it did nothing ... 2nd time he wouldn’t even eat them he didn’t like taste ... waste of money
customer_reviews.author: JennsKraftRoom

customer_reviews.title: Effective.
customer_reviews.text: It is great for the one kitty it is intended for. I break each one in half because it is too large at once. NOTE: once the package has been opened, even though it is resealable, the chews turn HARD! NOT GOOD! That's another reason I break them in half. One day, it got caught on his back teeth and I thought he would choke to death!! So now I break them in half so they are more manageable for him to chew. I only give 2 per day as needed... Very effective and he likes them.
customer_reviews.author: SAUNDRA D.

customer_reviews.title: My cats say nope.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I don’t know if this works or not. Neither of my cats will touch it. Either the flavor/texture/size is wrong or they are just too picky... and they usually eat anything. I will mention they smell like cardboard, so that’s probably unappetizing to cats. The size of the “treat “ is double or triple the size of “krave” style treat.
customer_reviews.author: K. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Too hard, cat won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: My cat will not eat these. They are extremely hard and even when I break them into 4 tiny pieces, she is not interested in eating them. Unless you have a cat who will eat ANYTHING or doesn't notice when you try to mix things into his/her food, don't get these. :(
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Wow! I’m a believer
customer_reviews.text: So far I love everything! My older cat is 16 and suffers from major bouts of anxiety and will howl and carry on. This so far is perfect. Takes about 30 min to start working and for Winston what it does for him is calms him I can tell he’s about to have an anxiety attack and it only last maybe a second and then he goes and lays down on his bed and just relaxes doesn’t knock him out or make them lethargic but it definitely calms his nerves which is great for him poor guy ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Griffey

customer_reviews.title: Old and Dried Up
customer_reviews.text: I've tried these before and had some luck with them. This bag arrived all dried up. None of the cats (nor the dogs) will take them. They are so hard that it is difficult to even break them so that the animals can smell the inside. Unfortunately, this was money wasted. I can't find an expiration date on them but they are definitely not fresh. Frustrated and sad that they are old and dried up.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Grannis

customer_reviews.title: Tasty and effective!!
customer_reviews.text: Written on behalf of cat by his human: I really enjoy my morning treat especially since my human decided to start taking me for car drives to prepare for a long (7 hour) uhaul trip to our new home. She continues to feed me this because I was super stressed and developed lip lesions related to it. She plans to feed me this for a few more months till I settle into my new home and make friends. I have tried other brands but I like this the best and eat it without any problem. Thank you helping me with my anxiety;)
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo09

customer_reviews.title: These treats are a matter of taste and preference for finicky felines.
customer_reviews.text: My one cat who eats EVERYTHING hates these. My other cat, who is VERY particular about his food, will only eat these if he's desperate. By that, I mean he's got to either be in a lot of pain and anxious about it (he's got a bad back paw), OR really, realllly hungry. Go figure!? 🤦 The treats are also a bit bulky and hard for him to chew which causes him to give up trying to eat them after repeatedly falling out of his mouth. If your cat decides to deal with these quirks, the product quality & ingredients are all good and it definitely helps with anxiety. Cats will be cats 😸💜!?
customer_reviews.author: Kaydee

customer_reviews.title: Cats wouldn't touch them
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if they work or not because my two cats weren't the slightest bit interested in them. Their reaction was more distaste at the smell than just disinterest. I was hopeful as they could really use the calming effect, but not for my boys. Hopefully your kitties won't be as particular.
customer_reviews.author: jammarc

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: Composure works great for my cat's anxiety. But the trick is knowing how much to give her. The package gives you an amount you can give them over a certain period of time. If I give her too much, it makes her anxiety worse but if I give her just the right amount, it works great. I just have to know the level of stress she's dealing with at the time. And I don't give it to her every day. Just when she's dealing with really stressful situations. I can't say it will work on every cat but it sure helps mine.
customer_reviews.author: Binx

customer_reviews.title: Product WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Better price than ANY pet store! This product DOES WORK! I don’t understand why people leave a negative review just because their cat won’t eat it. Every animal is different, I have 1 cat that eats it and 1 that won’t. It works wonders for the cat that eats it. I had a lot of problems with her, spent over $500 between 2 vet visits only to be told that it’s most likely a stress issue, bought these to try and she was back to herself within 2-3 days!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not calming!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed; they are not soft or chewy. They smell bad like some sort of vitamin, so I can’t imagine they taste good. Most importantly they did not calm my cat in any shape form or fashion. I have been giving it to my cat for one week multiple doses. I tried one tablet, did not work tried two tablets did not work etc. I definitely do not recommend this product. I would not waste my money!
customer_reviews.author: MissLuna

customer_reviews.title: Colostrum is the Key, I think
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 varieties of these sort of 'calm your demon kitty' chews. This is the only one with colostrum, and also the only one that really chills out my semi-feral housecats when they get to wanting to fuss with one another. Without these, it's WWIII. With these, it's a minor skirmish w/ hissing and growling and then everyone goes to sulk and take a nap in their separate places. Huge difference. The other chews don't seem to do much at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vee Enne

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: We bought these chews hoping it would calm our somewhat jumpy cat. Based on the reviews we were concerned that he might not even want to eat them. The good news is he absolutely loves them. They are rather large so we break the pieces up into smaller ones. We only gave four stars because while the treats seem to help calm him, the effect is mild and less than we hoped for. However, it's good enough that we ordered some more.
customer_reviews.author: LarryE195

customer_reviews.title: Great calming treats
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My cat has very active at night lately, so we give her one and a half of these and play with her a little before bed and it works perfectly so she sleeps through the night. For reference, she’s about 8 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Scrima

customer_reviews.title: Idk, cat loves em
customer_reviews.text: These smell terrible. I mean, it's a normal "pet food" smell so nothing to be concerned about, but I always had to hold my breath when opening these. My cat adores them and would scream at me once the bag was opened. She's extremely anxious so I was hoping these would help, but honestly I can't tell if they did. Regardless, they're treats that she loves.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Cat won’t eat them - don’t bother!
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats turned their noses up at merely the smell of these. One finicky - one would eat anything I put in front of him. The one that needs them ran from the smell. The calm one put it in his mouth and then spit it out. If they aren’t appealing to cats how do you use them??? Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey L. O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: No good, cats won’t touch them.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately all three of my cats absolutely refuse to eat these treats. I gave two stars because I have used the canine variety of these treats with a dog and they seemed to help. However my cats will not even touch these treats and one even retches and gags when she smells them.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Every cat is different, this did not work for my cats.
customer_reviews.text: My cats did not like this at all. While they normally beg for treats they spat this one out. It is hard to give like a pill as it crumbles easily. It did not calm my 13lb cat at all and only mildly calmed my 8lb cat, barely enough to even notice. She was still a wreck when traveling. We ended up needing to get a prescription medicine from our vet which worked way better. I had high hopes for this but unfortunately it fell short with my cats.
customer_reviews.author: dimas vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Cat says "meh"
customer_reviews.text: Neither my cat nor I am very impressed with these. Followed directions and poor thing hasn't chilled out at all. She's not even all that crazy about the flavor. She'll eat them, but takes her time. They seem to be dense and a bit difficult for her to chew, I've had to break them up for her. I'm rating a 2, but to be fair this may be one of those products that will work well on one pet, not so much for another. Won't be purchasing again though.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cooley

customer_reviews.title: My cats disapproved
customer_reviews.text: Neither of my cats will ear these. The cat that eats everything licked it and left it. The neurotic one we got them for... sniffed it and walked away. They don’t smell bad. A lot of calming treats smell like typical calming agents and cats won’t touch them. So, regrettably both of my cats won’t touch them. May try crumbing it in their food and see if that works.
customer_reviews.author: Evai

customer_reviews.title: my cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: I tried so hard to mix it with other treats and everything but my cat eats everything except this product. It was literarily waste of money for me. Maybe it depends on cats' taste but mine definitely did not like it and did not eat it.
customer_reviews.author: cigdem

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work and my cat likes them
customer_reviews.text: I have an alpha female who constantly prowls my other female cat. I’ve tried all sorts of intervention with little improvement so decided to try these “meds”. My cat loves them and there’s no issue with getting her to eat these. They appear to be working. She mellows out and just watches the other cat instead of going after her. Tried them 3x now and so far so good. Unfortunately the cat that gets attacked all the time doesn’t like them and won’t eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful after reading the reviews (which all seem positive!) that this would chill out my highly vocal cat. I tried different doses since shes a hefty girl but no matter the dose, it made no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: What a way to chill my cat
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for my cat Liam after my sister decided to get a dog after buying a house. He literally stayed in my room for a month once she got her dog Tuffy. Liam was scared and he only came out into the living room if I carried him. I have given these to him for going on 2 months now. He is more comfortable around Tuffy now. He comes out and roams the whole house. The funny thing is when Liam is out in the living room, Tuffy just ignored him. He didn't care he was there.
customer_reviews.author: karina

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: My cats wouldn't even touch this. I have 3 cats and one who will eat anything (literally, she eats lint off the floor), but this?? No way would the even try it. I even tried breaking one in half, thinking they'd like smaller pieces. Still nope.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: composure chews
customer_reviews.text: training to keep my indoor/outdoor cat in all the time. hoped they would help with the constant meowing to go outside They were a waste of money. Were not chewable, but hard -had awful smell and cat refused to eat them at all. wrapped turkey around them, gave with other treats, etc. nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: carol fine

customer_reviews.title: Not sure it's working
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats that have issues with aggression/chasing our older arthritic cat. I had been using a different calming treats along with behavior modification that had been working wonderfully. Unfortunately, the price went up and they're harder to find online. I decided to try this brand because it was much cheaper. Even though my cats have no issues eating it, I am not sure I can tell a difference in their behavior. They are both still chasing the other cat. I plan on giving it some more time (they've been on them for about a week), but if I continue to not see results I will probably switch back to the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved the flavor, the perfect chill out treat!
customer_reviews.text: My super picky kitty loves these!!! So far she has enjoyed all the vetriscience products. If you seal the bag properly the treats stay pretty soft. We used these when our other cat was diagnosed with cancer. They were not getting along as well and she was becoming aggressive towards our other cat when she became sick. She was confused. We gave her a treat and it really seems to just take the edge off. Didn't make her drowsy or act drugged, she just seemed chilled out. These were a great alternative to having to give her kitty prozac.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn & Logan Pool

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem to work
customer_reviews.text: Have tried 3-4 times with my cat and has little or no effect. He gets anxious for food. We now know it is a food related issue but still need some assistance to keep him calm in the evening. It did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Dandelion

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with feline hyperesthesia and don't want her doped up with Gabapentin all day. She loves these chews and they help to calm her between doses of medication, Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Whistler

customer_reviews.title: It is working!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue kitty. She is abnormally anxious. I have had her ten years. She does not associate with the rest of my clowder as she is too scared to join. I bought these to help her calm. First, she resists anything new, but absolutely loves these! By her second dose, she became much calmer. She has stopped pulling her hair and even lays beside me as I crochet! I am amazed. I can't thank you enough!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Break one into 6 pieces!
customer_reviews.text: They do seem to help calm my skittish car (and make my social cat much more snuggly) but they are hard and huge! I have to break one into six pieces with my nail and then they can eat the pieces and crumbs (they can’t eat any larger) and my cats are a little over 1 year. Seems like there should be more in the package, but they work so I’ll rebuy!
customer_reviews.author: Lazymominthe520

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't eat them
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted these to work, but like so many others, they haven't. My cat won't eat them, and she eats anything. They are really big, so I tried to break one up and hide it in her wet food but she was too smart for me and then wouldn't touch her wet food (which she LOVES). This product is a great idea - I just wish it were more palatable for the animals. I'm going to try Feliway spray next - I've heard that's a good alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Might work a little too well! I would definitely suggest start off with a half or 1/3 and work up how much your cat needs. We've had some changes in our household and 2 of our cats are hanging up on the 3rd. First night we gave all of them one each. The cat being bothered it did nothing, one it was just right, the other zonked out and was out of it for about 2 days. But these things do work and the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Immediate results for our skittish kitty
customer_reviews.text: I thought my cat had a rash on her belly; turns out it was overgrooming due to anxiety! My vet recommended these treats; we saw an immediate impact in our cat's skittishness and grooming habits, and her brother (a 9-year-old formerly feral feline) has shown the same positive results. They also seem to love the flavor and get excited every morning when we bring out the bag! Well-worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CopperBoom

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE the treats and so do I!!!! FANTASTIC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a treat that might help calm down my one cat who has Pandora Syndrome. This treat WORKS!!!! My cat wants to go outside but it's winter and he's cooped up in a very small home. Just one treat really calmed him down. We tried it over several days and noted how well it worked each time. THANK YOU for developing this!!! It's sad to see your cat "suffer" with anxiety, but it's a relief to have this product to help.
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful with psychogenic alopecia
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful with psychogenic alopecia. My six year old cat was non stop chewing her hair out. After a totally frustrating $200 vet exam which told me nothing I did my own "Google medical research". Found Composure on Amazon and it has made a significant difference in just one week. Fur chewing desire has almost completely stopped. Poor girl looks like she is stoned and spacey but very calm.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: I think they broke my cat!
customer_reviews.text: Well I guess they work he's out cold. Kitty's a stray we took in this summer and have been in the process of switching his schedule to stay inside at night. He usually paces the house and stirs at any movement to go and wait at the door. Never seen him sleep so deeply!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t notice any difference
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money I see no difference at all!! I don’t think these things work I’ve tried them for a few days I haven’t noticed any difference in my cats behavior he sleeps a lot anyway we haven’t gone to the vet but he just doesn’t seem any calmer
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY dissatisfied with these!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the Vetriscience Behavior for our dog, Lola, for years. She loves the taste of her thunderstorm/fireworks treats. The feline treats are too hard for our 2 cats & they will not eat them. Very dissatisfied with this product. Returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Incessant anxious meowing GONE!!!!!! :-)
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when buying this for my very loud vocal one year old cat. He would meow at the wall, ceiling, and air vents for no reason no matter what attention and reassurance. It was so bad that the other animals were anxious. We tried these treats hoping for some relief and WOAH!!! First treat we noticed a difference, he was playful but seemed calm. The incessant anxious meowing decreased if not stopped completely! He eats it right up! So far one a day keeps our insanity at bay!!! Calm kitty. Happy owners.
customer_reviews.author: DwightSchrute

customer_reviews.title: tried these as a first time kind of treatment for ...
customer_reviews.text: tried these as a first time kind of treatment for my diva cat....i didn't want her sleeping so all the time but sometimes just not be be stressed....we are in the current storm path (Hurricane Florence) and it's really helped her a lot...she loves the taste too !!! so paws up for this product from a very finicky cat !!
customer_reviews.author: hillary

customer_reviews.title: CALM KITTY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my kitty- she's very energetic....... sometimes when I need her to take it down a notch...I just crumble up one of these chews in 1/2 and sprinkle it in her food. It immediately calms her down and she's just a chill little kitty. I only use half and I notice it right away. She becomes very zen.
customer_reviews.author: mz.t

customer_reviews.title: THEY NEED TO MAKE A BIGGER PACK!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a small bag. I need a VALUE PACK NOW! Cat loves the taste of this and will actually eat it. Seems to work- has stopped my baby from nipping my ankles. I bought this and the Thunder Wunder calming chews at the same time. He wont touch the other stuff- and will eat around it even if I put it in his bowl with his other cat food. This is the winner.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works...when they stomach it.....
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, but the cat doesn't care for it. I have to rub Temptations Chicken treats on it before she'll even begin to think about taking this. My cat has some eye issues and was instructed by our vet that this and another product made by them would help. When she DOES take it, it works. Problem is, if your cat doesn't like it...the product doesn't work. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Smith

customer_reviews.title: So glad these exist
customer_reviews.text: Life saver. My baby boy has abandonment issues and more. He even wakes up in the middle of the night and howls for hours, scratches the paint off our walls, and the dish washer or washer&dryer being on makes him absolutely panic. With 2 of these treats he is so relaxed that I dont have to worry about him when I leave for work, waking up randomly at 3am howling, and the dish washer doesnt make him panic anymore. Next I'm going to try the pheromones to see if it will help him pee inside of the litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This took my crazy fierce cat that even the vet is scared of and totally chilled him out. One treat and he is chill for 3 hours or so. Haven't tried with the vet yet, but they work awesome to calm him at night. Also, they worked wonders to keep him chill after he was neutered and wasn't supposed to be jumping around.
customer_reviews.author: Suze in Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Cat was definitely chilled out!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was diagnosed with anxiety after we adopted a new puppy. Thought these treats might be a better alternative to anxiety meds. My cat doesn't really like the taste, and won't eat it on it's own, but will if I mix it with other treats. He definitely gets much calmer after taking it. And seems to be less stressed. I would say they work!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Loo

customer_reviews.title: Helps my crazy Karma!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old kitten (Karma) gets crazy hyper some nights, just as I'm getting ready for bed. She will race across my bed (and me) repeatedly, and knock stuff o her as she races around the apartment. I got these calming treats for an entirely different reason, but they work great for those times that she's keeping me awake at night. They must have a good flavor for cats because she eats it no problem, and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Aerdnna

customer_reviews.title: It’s good only for short time
customer_reviews.text: I think it just depends on your pet- my experience may be unique- but my cat isn’t the biggest fan of these treats, she doesn’t go nuts over them like regular treats, but she tolerates it and eats it.. they seem to calm her down in about 20-40 mins and only lasts 3ish hours.. i was looking for more of a relaxing treat for separation anxiety up to 6-8 hours..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works With Our Wild One
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and decided what the hell, especially after he attacked his roommate two days in a row. The first three days, I fed him two, now he gets one a day. He calmed down. No more attacks and his tail isn't thrashing back and forth, like his is nervous. We all need a little help sometime. This helped ours to calm down.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie SK

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: I am assuming the flavor rating by the fact that she ate them...?? overall I think they did have an impact on my cat, I always gave her two and she seemed to be cuddly and more WILLING to be mellow but not compelled to only be mellow as if she was “high”. I think they helped her relax as she suffers from anxiety of sorts. i’d say they’re worth trying
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not great
customer_reviews.text: Great product pricey tho and are too large for my cat have to be broken down and getting 2 cause she needs them into her daily before bed due to size can be a task. I wont force them into her due to her anxiety. They do work wonders tho. My cat is 8 and can't deal with2 3 years olds this helps not sedate her but calm her nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Gibbskeg

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't try them
customer_reviews.text: My cat won't eat these so I don't know if they even work. They were not hard as the other reviewers mentioned but they did smell like vitamins. I tried cutting them up, batting them around, mixing them with food. I even pretended I was eating them! My cat was absolutely not into it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: When cats are acting up, instead of fussing with them give them this treat!
customer_reviews.text: This a life saver when your cat gets hyper and is out of control behavior. I thoughtI would never use something like this after having cats all my life! Most all my cats have been Siamese. This kitten is a seal point grown to 15 LBS. I bought as a kitten. He gets very angry when I have corrected him and bites! This med. 1 treat calms him down! It works! Only used when nesscary!
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Didn't help calm my cat at all. Each treat seems very hard to chew I am having to cut it into 3 pieces for my cat to even acknowledge it and attempt to chew it (I have a young healthy cat with perfect teeth).
customer_reviews.author: Toneduptitties

customer_reviews.title: Cat refuses to eat these
customer_reviews.text: My cat refuses to eat these, she will start chewing them and then spits them out every time. I was really hoping these worked but I will never know since my cat evidently thinks they taste like $#@& .
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: happy campers
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats 10 and 8 years old the thunderstorms have been causing stress so I tried these treats I read a lot of the reviews and look forward with the purchase when they arrived you having bad thunderstorms the cats were quite upset so we gave the treats and 20 minutes later they were happy campers
customer_reviews.author: K L F

customer_reviews.title: Large treats, hard and not chewy
customer_reviews.text: My cat was interested, but they were just too hard. I got a knife to break one up for her, and she tried to eat the little bits but they were just like little gravel. Not chewy at all!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Complete waste of money. Which bums me out because my cat is SUPER anxious and exhibits horrible behaviors because of it. I had high hopes from the reviews. Upon opening the package, there was a very strong medicinal smell and I knew instantly that she wouldn’t eat them. We tried anyway. Of course, she didn’t eat it. They were also hard as a rock. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Harris

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them, reports no noticeable behavioral effect
customer_reviews.text: Ruby says: “Mommy gives me one of these sometimes when I am ‘acting crazy’ or when she is trying to make me go to cat jail. I think that is hilarious! These kitty treats taste so good and I love them so much so I’m not sure why mommy said we can only give them two stars. I eat one and then run around and jump on things and meow at mommy until she plays with me for 2 hours! WHEEEEEEE!!”
customer_reviews.author: Emily W

customer_reviews.title: I have 12 cats so these are a great treat to give to the ones that are a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 cats so these are a great treat to give to the ones that are a bit more anxious. My youngest cat is the one that gets them the most and every morning she is waiting for her treat. I was happily surprised at how much the cats like these - I am always apprehensive when it comes to treats for cats since they can be picky eaters. They are a bit pricey, so I limit them to just the cats that I feel need a bit of help with coping with the multi-cat environment.
customer_reviews.author: EckybayS

customer_reviews.title: Stress-free kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat has an autoimmune disorder where stress causes her to develop bladder infections. Her vet recommended her to be in a very stress free environment with little changes. We were moving and I gave her 2 about 30 minutes before we brought her in and no issues! I break them up for her because theyre kinda big for a cat... Any chances in the house hold these have been great for calming her down.
customer_reviews.author: Savanah

customer_reviews.title: Cat hated them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for one of my cats that has anxiety. He was not interested in them. They have a very vitamin-y smell, and he was not having it. I then tried to crush it up in his wet food, but he wouldn't touch it. My other cat (that doesn't need them) ate them just fine. They are not chewy; they are crunchy. Don't know if they work for calming, as the cat that needs it doesn't like them.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: your cat may respond better. The positive thing about these treats is that ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried these for my antisocial and anxious cat, as part of getting her accustomed to the other cats in the household. Even when they're administered daily, they don't seem to have a really noticeable calming effect. Then again, the cat I'm treating is very high-anxiety ... your cat may respond better. The positive thing about these treats is that the cat seems to like them.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: I Have My Sanity Back!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes my cats can be absolutely annoyingly rambunctious (well often times but most of the time I am fine with it). When I can't handle it, they get one of these and my sanity comes back! Helps chill them out a lot! They apparently taste fine since they happily see them as treats. Did I mention these help bring back my sanity? Definitely recommend! Especially if you have a few high strung furbabies!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya B

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for what I bought it for (fair enough though)
customer_reviews.text: Cat loved it as a treat, but did not change his stress level in the car at all, not suitable for moving our cat across the country with high car anxiety. (Not that they wouldn't work for others but honestly our cat was no different after taking them)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Swedin

customer_reviews.title: The cats eat them without any trouble.
customer_reviews.text: Both my rescued cats will eat these treats. Have been using the treats to try to relieve some stress while they get used to each other. (Male was first here, female just brought in this past fall) They are doing MUCH better but there are still some times they are unhappy about sharing their space. These seem to help more than the plug-in pheromone things.
customer_reviews.author: Pat F.

product_meta.title: VetriScience Laboratories Composure, Calming Formula for Cats, 30 Bite-Sized Chews
product_meta.description: Composure for Cats is a calming formula designed to address nervousness and stress caused by environmental factors such as storms, travel or veterinary visits. Composure uses the natural power of colostrum, l-theanine and thiamine to ease nervousness without sedating your pet. Available in a cat friendly soft chew Composure is easy to administer and provides fast acting relief for nervous felines without changing their personality. Composure for Cats is a calming formula designed to address nervousness and stress caused by environmental factors like storms, travel or veterinary visits. Available in a cat friendly soft chew, Composure provides fast acting relief.
feature_bullets: Composure uses the natural power of Colostrum, L-Theatine and Thiamine to ease nervousness without effecting your cat’ S personality.
Composure is veterinarian formulated calming formula and has been Approved by our Veterinary review board to support behavior issues in cats.
Composure soft chews have a tasty, chicken Liver flavor that cats love.
Composure begins working in 20-30 minutes. Dosing can be doubled or tripled to achieve the desired result.
Composure for cats is safe for long term use. Packaging May Vary.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
